oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Volunteers gather bags of debris during a cleanup with the Harpeth River Watershed Association in Bellevue after the May 2010 flood
oai_dc:dc.dc:description:
A photograph of volunteers gathering bags full of debris from a lake in Bellevue, located off Old Hickory Boulevard near the Carmike Bellevue 8 Cinemas, after the May 2010 flood. The volunteers were part of the Presbyterian Disaster Assistance group and the cleanup took place March 3, 2011 with the Harpeth River Watershed Association.
Photo courtesy of Harpeth River Watershed Association.
Forms part of the Nashville Room Flood 2010 Digital History Project.
